p: The interval of 10 days between the onset of viral illness respiratory symptoms and the first manifestations of Guillain–Barré syndrome in our case, is similar to cases reported by Galan( Galán et al., 2020) and Virani( Virani et al., 2020). This interval was 5–10 days in case series by Toscano that is quiet the same as occurs during or after other infections( Toscano et al., 2020). Considering the temporal association, we hypothesize that there is causal relationship between GBS and SARS-CoV-2 infection, but there is no evidence of direct invasion of nerves or nerve roots by virus, as the CSF was negative for SARS-CoV-2 in patient reported by Alberti( Alberti et al., 2020).
